title: Towergate Logotype
content:
Hi there,

Anyone out ther know what typeface the towergate logotype uses?

Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130225113431im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Towergate-logo_3780.jpg)
author: Julian_N

comments.content:
It's close to Newhouse DT Super Condensed Bold

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dtptypes/newhouse-dt/super-condensed-bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130225113431/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dtptypes/newhouse-dt/super-condensed-bold/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dtptypes/newhouse-dt/super-condensed-bold/")

But the shapes of the letters are actually more rounded, the a has an extending foot and the t has an angled top.

It's possible this is a custom font for Towergate, but I don't actually know for sure.

A larger image:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130225113431im_/http:/typophile.com/files/towergate_5980.jpg)
As I looked at Venus I realized it could be the Font Bureau's version: [Vonness](http://web.archive.org/web/20130225113431/http:/fontbureau.com/custom/fonts/Vonness/).
